Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Why do we need an empty check? 
if the interface is there, put it out?
Acknowledged
LOG_ERROR if empty?
WARNING maybe?
Acknowledged

We are in a tricky spot with PCIe Slots. 
There is a commit up to remove them https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/71057

Redfish moved away from this schema and pcie slot part of pcie device
Isn't this just location codes? What is going on here? The commit msg says "Bmcweb: Add PcieSlots Location Code". PCIeSlot Location codes is all I would expect
please ignore this part, I have removed this.
Done
How is this tied to pcie slot locaiton code?
not required. mistakenly got it while rebasing.
Done
This seems like a separate commit
yeah, fixed it.
Done
This is the code I would expect in this commit.
Right , this is the actual change with this commit.
Done
What if the slot doesn't have the interface?
we get failure , saying something like this - "interface" is not valid for this service, object.
okay
Done
How could this have possibly been true?  pcie_slots.hpp isn't actually built into the code.
Besides the direction of the PCIeSlot removal, the code looks good to me.

please explain, I didn't get it -
"the direction of the PCIeSlot removal,"

Redfish has deprecated this schema. 
Redfish has included the slot properties as part of the PCIeDevice. 
An empty PICe Slot will look like an empty Dimm Slot and be a PCIeDevice resource with State = Absent (A empty Dimm Slot is a Memory resource with State=Absent). 

I am okay adding this, but long term know PCIe Slot is going away. 
Today, it isn't included in the build and there has been discussion of removing it https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/71057
Looks good to me. A couple minor comments.
This isn't in https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/Redfish.md  which I think is best
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/63474 is the same change

Let start by getting some documentation in the commit message that recognizes that pcie_slots.hpp is:

Not included anywhere
Not initialized anywhere.  RequestRoutesPCIeSlots is not called in the codebase: https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Aopenbmc%2Fbmcweb+requestRoutesPCIeSlots&type=code

Which means this is dead code, and there's no way that the tests that claim to be run were run on this codebase.  I'm assuming they were run on a fork, which is fine, but we need to be honest about what we want here.  As far as this codebase is concerned, this is dead code that had to be reverted shortly after it was merged, and has never worked as designed, and nobody followed up to fix the issues with it.

Lets get the intent written down in the patchset for what we want to accomplish with this review, before we spend a lot of time diving into the specifics of the code.  Redfish has deprecated this schema in leiu of PCIeDevice, which we also implement, so in terms of this patch I'm unclear what we're trying to accomplish.


Once that's written down, we can start having a discussion around what we want to happen.
include memory
include string
I think DEBUG or INFO here..
Still unaddressed comments
